alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Aroostook County through 700 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Bridgewater to Smyrna Mills. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Hodgdon, Smyrna, Smyrna Mills, Dudley Township, Littleton, Monticello, Oakfield, New Limerick, Ludlow, Merrill and Dyer Brook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 286 and 304. US Highway 1 between Houlton and Monticello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
